posts.title: Litan
posts.excerpt: In the town of Litan, a local festival or celebration day is occurring—townsfolk dress in masks, play music, make merry. Nora (Marie-José Nat) awakens from a nightmare and is convinced that she’s prophesied some impending doom. Rushing to her husband, Jock (Mocky), who’s job involves some kind of demolition work at “the Black Rocks,” she …

posts._title: Carlos Aured – Los ojos azules de la muñeca rota AKA Blue Eyes of the Broken Doll AKA House of Psychotic Women (1974)
posts.title: Los ojos azules de la muñeca rota
posts.excerpt: Sometimes its okay to judge a book by its cover and a film by its title. This blood-soaked cheapo Spanish horror film is a good example. Starring popular creepshow star Paul Naschy, it is the grim tale of three twisted sisters, a one-handed brunette, a wheel-chair bound blonde and a nymphomaniacal redhead who bedevil a …
posts.titleEnglish: Blue Eyes of the Broken Doll AKA House of Psychotic Women

posts.title: Love Me Tonight
posts.excerpt: Parisian tailor Maurice Courtelin (Maurice Chevalier) goes to the chateau of the Duke d’Artelines (C. posts._title: André De Toth – Last of the Comanches (1953)
posts.title: Last of the Comanches
posts.excerpt: IMDB wrote:It’s 1876 and all the Indians are at peace except the Comanches lead by Black Cloud. When Black Cloud wipes out a town, only six soldiers are left and they head for the nearest fort. In the desert they are reinforced by members of a stagecoach and find some water at a deserted mission. …

posts._title: Federico Francioni & Cheng Yan – Tomba del Tuffatore AKA Tomb of the Diver (2016)
posts.title: Tomba del Tuffatore
posts.excerpt: Imdb:A dive into the contemporay void: a passage from life to death

posts._title: Federico Francioni & Cheng Yan – The First Shot (2017)
posts.title: The First Shot
posts.excerpt: Three different locations in china.Three distant existences in search for their own identity. synopsis:three distant and diverse existences caught in a same tension: the search for their own identity and the sense of ‘’being’’ in a present of continuous transformation. All of them was born after 1989 the end of all the revolutions.

posts.title: Les gaz mortels
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Hopson, a prestigious scientist, studies the effect of snake venom to cure many diseases of mankind. His son enlists in the army when the Great War breaks out. A series of circumstances will lead the scientist to change his way of thinking about values ​​and principles that until then he had as immovable.

posts._title: Raymond Bernard – Le septième ciel AKA Seventh Heaven (1958)
posts.title: Le septième ciel
posts.excerpt: “Le septième ciel” became Raymond Bernard’s last film; a black comedy about a female brewery owner who donates vast amounts of money to charitable causes. The funds to do this, she raises through her liaisons with wealthy gentlemen… who just “happen” to end up dead!

posts._title: Denys de La Patellière – Les grandes familles AKA The Possessors (1958)
posts.title: Les grandes familles
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:With interests ranging from banking to commodities and publishing, the Schoudlers are one of France’s wealthiest and most powerful business families. The present head of this formidable dynasty is Noël Schoudler, a driven, plain-speaking magnate who runs his affairs with an unwavering ruthlessness, and this applies as much to his private life as it does …

posts._title: Shôhei Imamura – Hateshinaki yokubô AKA Endless Desire (1958) (HD)
posts.title: Hateshinaki yokubô
posts.excerpt: Quote:Ten years after World War II, five people set out dig up a stash of morphine buried under a butcher shop in this black comedy by Shohei Imamura.
